thread.title: Oil Retreats From Three-Year High as Syria Tensions Simmer

author: Christopher Alessi
title: Oil Retreats From Three-Year High as Syria Tensions Simmer
text:
Oil prices retreated from a three-year high on Monday as geopolitical risks to supply receded.
Light, sweet crude for May delivery fell $1.17, or 1.7%, to $66.22 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange, snapping a five-session winning streak. Brent, the global benchmark, fell $1.16, or 1.6%, to $71.42 a barrel.
U.S. crude prices closed...
